channel.title: How To Tell Client Version?
channel.description:
Hallo, I am wondering how can I tell what version a client is ( 194, 317, 508..etc...) ? Just by the cache ( .jagex_cache_32...)
I am also wondering if jagex put any other files on your computer other than just the cache .jagex_cache_32... Im taking old caches from school computers because I'm bored XD
Danke ! Have A Great Day !! ;D

item.title: How To Tell Client Version?
item.dc:creator: @mopar_fan mopar fan
item.description:
@mopar_fan wrote:

I evil I:

194?? holy bawlz

Haha, yup =]
I know its there…somewhere…
My school played Runescape Beta + Classic back in those days =P I’m gonna hope there’s one computer with it ^^

“The RSMV (model editor) tells you when you it scans RS”

Where can I find this? Danke.

Client.java

" public final int clientVer = 317;"
may vary from client to client not sure

Will notepad do?

Also, apparently there is a directory with files other than the cache??
It is %cachedir%/l and m
Where would this be???

Is there even a such directory that has the map and landscape file data?

I am doing this tomorrow-ish, anyone know where this would be?

My school blocked the runescape.com website shortly after the runescape beta came out in 2004.
As such, there could be a cache with this:
http://tinyurl.com/3zx4t7y
http://tinyurl.com/6dopfay

Danke !!

Read full topic
